summary: The Constitutional Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act (H.R. 38) aims to establish national reciprocity for concealed carry rights. It would allow an individual who can legally carry a concealed handgun in their home state to do so in any other state that permits concealed carry. To qualify, the person must carry a valid photo ID and not be federally prohibited from possessing a firearm. The bill does not override state laws restricting firearms on private or government property. It provides legal protections, including awarding attorney's fees for successful legal defenses and allowing civil action against those who violate these rights.
